segments.en: Linked Discourses 12
4. Kaḷāra the Aristocrat
39. Intention (2nd)
At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: “Yañca, bhikkhave, ceteti yañca pakappeti yañca anuseti, ārammaṇametaṃ hoti viññāṇassa ṭhitiyā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, what you intend or plan, and what you have underlying tendencies for become a support for the continuation of consciousness.
When this support exists, consciousness becomes established.

segments.pli: Tasmiṃ patiṭṭhite viññāṇe virūḷhe nāmarūpassa avakkanti hoti.
segments.en: When consciousness is established, name and form are conceived.
Name and form are conditions for the six sense fields.
The six sense fields are conditions for contact.
Contact is a condition for feeling. …
craving …
grasping …
continued existence …
rebirth …
old age and death,
sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress come to be.
That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.

segments.pli: No ce, bhikkhave, ceteti no ce pakappeti, atha ce anuseti, ārammaṇametaṃ hoti viññāṇassa ṭhitiyā.
segments.en: If you don’t intend or plan, but still have underlying tendencies, this becomes a support for the continuation of consciousness.
When this support exists, consciousness becomes established.

segments.pli: Tasmiṃ patiṭṭhite viññāṇe virūḷhe nāmarūpassa avakkanti hoti.
segments.en: When consciousness is established, name and form are conceived.
Name and form are conditions for the six sense fields. …
That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.

segments.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, no ceva ceteti no ca pakappeti no ca anuseti, ārammaṇametaṃ na hoti viññāṇassa ṭhitiyā.
segments.en: If you don’t intend or plan or have underlying tendencies, this doesn’t become a support for the continuation of consciousness.

segments.pli: Ārammaṇe asati patiṭṭhā viññāṇassa na hoti.
segments.en: With no support, consciousness is not established.

segments.pli: Tadappatiṭṭhite viññāṇe avirūḷhe nāmarūpassa avakkanti na hoti.
segments.en: When consciousness is not established, name and form are not conceived.
When name and form cease, the six sense fields cease. …
That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”

suttaplex.blurb: Intentions or choices are the force that propels consciousness from one life to the next.
